title: Putting America First in International Environmental Agreements
summary: This executive order aims to prioritize American interests over international environmental agreements, potentially withdrawing the United States from such agreements. It seeks to protect American jobs and industries by minimizing the financial obligations associated with global environmental initiatives.
full_text: Universities like Yale, which have significant research and sustainability initiatives tied to international environmental agreements, may face reduced funding and increased operational costs as a result of this executive order. The potential withdrawal from these agreements could also impact collaborations and partnerships with international institutions.

university_impact_areas.name: Workforce & Employment Policy
university_impact_areas.description: Impacts on faculty, staff employment, labor relations, and workforce diversity
